sentences.en: Both Guldner and Stafford see greater conflict avoidance and a tendency to idealize a faraway partner.
sentences.cn: 高勒和斯塔福都认为异地恋爱可以回避更多矛盾,更趋向于把另一半理想化.

sentences.en: Cultivate your hunger before you idealize.
sentences.cn: 在你幻想前激发你的渴望.

sentences.en: For the past several years, however, it has been very easy to idealize it even more.
sentences.cn: 但在过去的几年中, 它越来越被理想化了.

sentences.en: He tends to idealize his life in the army.
sentences.cn: 他总想使自己在军队里的生活理想化.

sentences.en: I don't want to idealize life in small places.
sentences.cn: 我不想理想化在小地方的生活.

sentences.en: I warned you not to idealize me.
sentences.cn: 我告诫过你不要把我理想化.

sentences.en: In the honeymoon stage, partners idealize each other , seeing only their partner's best qualities, said Commerford.
sentences.cn: 康墨德说,在蜜月期, 双方都理想化伴侣, 看到的只是彼此的优点.

sentences.en: It is tempting to idealize the past.
sentences.cn: 人都爱把过去的日子说得那么美好。

sentences.en: Society continues to idealize the two-parent family.
sentences.cn: 社会依然把双亲家庭视为理想家庭。

sentences.en: The pure office of poetry is ever to idealize.
sentences.cn: 诗的纯正功能向来都是理想化地描绘事物.

sentences.en: They tend to idealize their friends.
They worship bigness yet idealize the little man.
sentences.cn: 他们敬慕声名显赫的大人物,同时又把不见经传的小人物理想化.

sentences.en: Young man make great mistakes in life; for one thing, they idealize love too much.
sentences.cn: 年轻人在生活中常犯大错误; 比如说, 他们把爱情太过于理想化了.

sentences.en: Young men make great mistakes in life; for one thing idealize love too much.
